column4: Hi ! How do I extract archives having an 'xz' extension ? For example, "file.tar.xz".
You should also be able to just double click them.
Thanks, but I get this error : "bash: unxz: command not found".
It should then give you the command you need to run to install unxz.
No, it doesn't. I understand, that you get something like 'app' can be installed by 'sudo apt-get install app' but in this case, I only get the above mentioned error.
Can you pastebin the output of "lsb_release -a"?
Is there a way I can install 'unxz' from source code and then use it ?
You don't need to. Can you pastebin the output of "lsb_release -a"?
Yes, I did send you the link, http://paste.ubuntu.com/593458/
Sorry, missed it the first time.
That's fine, but any luck on this ?
Please upgrade to a supported release.
Gosh, I'm waiting for natty to come out, and till then this is only a stop gap arrangement. Could you help ma manually install 'unxz' ? Possibly from source.
I don't particularly like to try to support EOL software, and it's officially not supported in this channel so you're pretty much on your own :(
Oh, well. Thanks anyway for your time. :)
